text: Decide how you want to serve the ham and sauce. You could drizzle or pour the sauce over sliced ham, mix the sauce with vegetables and ham cubes and serve it with or over rice, or create a stir fry with the rice and vegetables. Cook the ham, or use pre-cooked ham.  Cook the rice. This is simplest in a rice cooker because you don't have to pay attention to it while you're making the rest of the meal. Combine vinegar, brown sugar, ketchup, and soy sauce in a small saucepan. Stir to mix well. Don't heat it up yet! Combine corn starch and water. Stir until there are no lumps. Add corn starch mixture to the saucepan and mix well.  Heat on stove until thick and bubbling. Stir constantly. Combine and serve with the ham and rice as you have chosen. This recipe makes about 2/3 cup of sauce. Adjust ham and rice quantities to fit serving method. For stir fry: Heat the rice, ham cubes, and peas and carrots in a hot stir fry pan. Stir constantly to prevent sticking. Remove from heat and cool slightly or transfer to a serving dish before adding sauce, to prevent it from burning to the pan. To make as a side sauce: Stir-fry snow peas, green pepper, and ham over medium heat, then add pineapple until warm. Remove from heat and combine with sauce last, to prevent sticking to the pan. Serve with or over rice. Finished.
